question.text: Which of the following is the correct prediction about observed <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math> bond length in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>BF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> molecule?

options.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math> bond length in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>BF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> is found to be less than theoretical value because the electronegativity values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mfenced><mrow><mo>2.04</mo></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mfenced><mrow><mo>4.0</mo></mrow></mfenced></math> suggest the bond length to be ionic and hence, the attraction between oppositely charged ions must decrease the bond length.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>BF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mfenced close="]" open="["><msub><mi>BF</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mfenced><mo>−</mo></msup></math> have equal <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math> bond length.

The decrease in the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math> bond length in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>BF</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> is due to delocalised <math> <mrow> <mtext>p</mtext> <mi>π</mi> <mo>-</mo> <mtext>p</mtext> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> </math> bonding between vacant <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></math> orbital of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and filled <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></math> orbital of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math>

The correct <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> bond length order is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>Cl</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>Br</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math>

solution.text: It has partial double character in B−F bond due to  p π - p π back bonding.
